prompt.system_instruction: You are an AI Assistant, tasked with providing responses that are well-grounded in the provided documents. Given one or more documents and a user query, generate a response to the query. If no answer can be found in the documents, say, "I do not have specific information".

messages.speaker: user
messages.text: How can I obtain a replacement for my lost New York boating safety certificate?

messages.speaker: agent
messages.text: You can order a replacement for your lost New York boating safety certificate online at https://www.ilostmycard.com/. However, if you lost temporary certificates, the temporary certificates cannot be replaced. Additionally, please note that NYS can only issue replacement certificates for the NY Safe Boating Course.

contexts.text:
Boating Frequently Asked Questions - NYS Parks, Recreation & Historic Preservation

No. If you are at least 18 years old, you may rent without completing a course. The livery must demonstrate how to properly use the boat before renting it. Persons under the age of 18 may only rent a motorboat if they hold a 
	safety certificate.
I lost my safety certificate. How can I get a replacement?
	You can order your replacement certificate online at https://www.ilostmycard.com/
What if I lost my temporary certificate?
	Temporary certificates cannot be replaced.
Can I make a copy of my Boating Safety Certificate to keep onboard my boat?
	No, you must have the original certificate on your person or on board the boat if you are the operator.
Why haven't I received my safety certificate yet?
	It takes approximately 90 days from your course completion date for your permanent certificate to arrive in the mail. Your temporary certificate is valid through those 90 days. If you are over 18 years of age, you must purchase your certificate from https://www.ilostmycard.com/ before it will be mailed to you. If you are within 7 days of your temporary certificate’s expiration date and have not yet received your card, please email us at boating@parks.ny.gov
How can I become an instructor?
	To become a State certified instructor, you must be at least 18 years of age, be able to demonstrate an ability to instruct and must have taken a New York State Parks classroom course. For more information, or to begin the certification process, click here
I have a US Coast Guard Auxiliary boating safety certificate. Can I exchange it for a New York boating safety certificate?
	A boating safety certificate issued by the US Coast Guard Auxiliary is recognized as a valid safe boating certificate – you do not need any further documentation. The same is true of certificates issued by the US Power Squadron/America’s Boating Club.
I took a class online and I have lost my permanent card, can you issue me a replacement card?
	You need to go to the online provider that issued your card. The same is true for lost Power Squadron and Coast Guard Auxiliary cards. NYS can only issue replacement certificates for the NY Safe Boating Course.
contexts.title: Boating Frequently Asked Questions - NYS Parks, Recreation & Historic Preservation

ml.tokens.model_text: |user|: How can I obtain a replacement for my lost New York boating safety certificate?

contexts.text:
Boating Frequently Asked Questions - NYS Parks, Recreation & Historic Preservation

A boating safety certificate issued by the US Coast Guard Auxiliary is recognized as a valid safe boating certificate – you do not need any further documentation. The same is true of certificates issued by the US Power Squadron/America’s Boating Club.
I took a class online and I have lost my permanent card, can you issue me a replacement card?
	You need to go to the online provider that issued your card. The same is true for lost Power Squadron and Coast Guard Auxiliary cards. NYS can only issue replacement certificates for the NY Safe Boating Course.
The back of my certificate says its approved by "NASBLA". What is that? 
	The National Association of State Boating Law Administrators (NASBLA) is a national nonprofit organization that works to develop public policy for recreational boating safety. NASBLA represents the recreational boating 
	authorities of all 50 states and the U.S. territories.

In Classroom Course
This course is designed as a comprehensive boating safety course, teaching the fundamentals of safe boating operation and has been approved by the National Association of Boating Law Administrators (NASBLA).

Students must be at least 10 years of age to attend the course.
This course requires a minimum of 8 hours of classroom instruction.
Courses are available throughout the state.
You must register for your course online at https://www.register-ed.com/programs/new_york/252-new-york-safe-boating-course
An instructor may or may not charge a fee for the course. If a fee is charged, they may vary depending upon who is offering the course. Some courses may be taught by volunteers free of charge.
Students will receive a temporary boating safety certificate upon completion of the course.
Permanent boating safety certificates do not expire.

Fees
Courses are taught by volunteer or paid instructors. Volunteers are free of charge, but an instructor may charge a fee for the course. Fees may vary.
Students 18 years of age and older will be required to pay a $10 fee to NYS for issuance of a permanent boating safety certificate.
Cost for a replacement certificate is $10.00 regardless of age
How do I find out if there is a fee for the class?
contexts.title: Boating Frequently Asked Questions - NYS Parks, Recreation & Historic Preservation

ml.tokens.model_text: |user|: How can I obtain a replacement for my lost New York boating safety certificate?

messages.original_text: According to the provided document, you can order a replacement for your lost New York boating safety certificate online at [https://www.ilostmycard.com/](https://www.ilostmycard.com/). If you are within 7 days of your temporary certificate’s expiration date and have not yet received your card, you are advised to email [boating@parks.ny.gov](mailto:boating@parks.ny.gov). However, please note that NYS can only issue replacement certificates for the NY Safe Boating Course. If you obtained your certificate from a different online provider, Power Squadron, or Coast Guard Auxiliary, you need to contact them for a replacement.

messages.speaker: user
messages.text: do I have to have Boating safety certificates ?

messages.speaker: agent
messages.text: In New York, anyone operating a Personal Watercraft (JetSki™, Wave Runner™, etc.) must have a boating safety certificate and be at least 14 years of age or older. Starting in 2024, if you are operating any other type of motorized boat, you will need a safety certificate if you were born on or after January 1, 1978. Starting in 2025, all operators of motorized vessels, regardless of age, will be required to have a safety certificate. However, if you are renting a boat, you do not need a safety certificate if you are at least 18 years old, although the livery must demonstrate how to properly use the boat before renting it. Persons under the age of 18 may only rent a motorboat if they hold a safety certificate.

Boating Frequently Asked Questions - NYS Parks, Recreation & Historic Preservation

Boating Frequently Asked Questions - NYS Parks, Recreation & Historic Preservation

Boating Frequently Asked Questions

Home / Boating / Education / Frequently Asked Questions

New York Safe Boating Education Program

Boating Safety Certificates
Who needs a boating safety certificate?
	Anyone operating a Personal Watercraft (JetSki™, Wave Runner™, etc.) must have a boating safety certificate, and be at least 14 years of age or older.
In 2024: If you are operating any other type of motorized boat, you will need a safety certificate if you were born January 1, 1978 or later. Starting in 2025, all operators of motorized vessels, regardless of age, will be required to have a safety certificate.
I earned a state safety certificate when I was young. Does that count?
	We do not have all course records prior to 2000. Any certificate issued prior to 2000 is only acceptable if you have a copy of it and you were under 18 years of age when it was issued. All NYS boating safety certificates issued
	after 2000, regardless of age, are acceptable.
I took course prior to 2000, but lost my certificate - what should I do?
	Unfortunately, we do not have records for all students who took the course prior to the year 2000.
contexts.title: Boating Frequently Asked Questions - NYS Parks, Recreation & Historic Preservation

	You can order your replacement certificate online at https://www.ilostmycard.com/

	Temporary certificates cannot be replaced.
Can I make a copy of my Boating Safety Certificate to keep onboard my boat?
	No, you must have the original certificate on your person or on board the boat if you are the operator.

	It takes approximately 90 days from your course completion date for your permanent certificate to arrive in the mail. Your temporary certificate is valid through those 90 days. If you are over 18 years of age, you must purchase your certificate from https://www.ilostmycard.com/ before it will be mailed to you. If you are within 7 days of your temporary certificate’s expiration date and have not yet received your card, please email us at boating@parks.ny.gov
How can I become an instructor?
	To become a State certified instructor, you must be at least 18 years of age, be able to demonstrate an ability to instruct and must have taken a New York State Parks classroom course. For more information, or to begin the certification process, click here
I have a US Coast Guard Auxiliary boating safety certificate. Can I exchange it for a New York boating safety certificate?
	A boating safety certificate issued by the US Coast Guard Auxiliary is recognized as a valid safe boating certificate – you do not need any further documentation. The same is true of certificates issued by the US Power Squadron/America’s Boating Club.

ml.tokens.model_text: do I have to have Boating safety certificates ?

messages.original_text: In New York, certain individuals are required to have a boating safety certificate. Specifically, anyone operating a Personal Watercraft (JetSki™, Wave Runner™, etc.) must have a boating safety certificate and be at least 14 years of age or older. Starting in 2024, if you are operating any other type of motorized boat, you will need a safety certificate if you were born on or after January 1, 1978. Starting in 2025, all operators of motorized vessels, regardless of age, will be required to have a safety certificate. However, if you are renting a boat, you do not need a safety certificate if you are at least 18 years old, although the livery must demonstrate how to properly use the boat before renting it. Persons under the age of 18 may only rent a motorboat if they hold a safety certificate.

messages.speaker: agent
messages.text: You can either register your boat online or call the DMV at (518) 486-9786. Note that if your boat is powered by a motor (electric or fuel-driven), it must be registered, regardless of the size of the craft or the motor.

contexts.text:
Motor Boating - NYSDEC
See our Frequently Asked Questions (PDF)Register your Boat at the DMVIf you use a motor (electric or fuel-driven), no matter how small the craft or the motor, you must register your boat with the Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV).You can either register your boat online or call the DMV at (518) 486-9786. (Note: In New York, watercraft without a motor do not need to be registered.)Boating Safety Courses and CertificationFor information about boating certificate requirements and boating safety courses, call the OPRHP at (518) 474-0456 or visit the OPRHP boating education page.

contexts.title: Motor Boating - NYSDEC

ml.tokens.model_text: To register your boat (renewed every 3 years):

contexts.text:
Motor Boating - NYSDEC
Be sure to adhere to all boating regulations and requirements prior to launching, including properly cleaning your boat, getting your boat registered, and obtaining boater safety certification.
 
 

Places to Launch Your Boat

Boat Launch Sites

DECinfo Locator (an interactive map)

New York State Boat Launching Sites (PDF)

HuntFishNY Mobile App

Boat Cleaning and DisinfectingBoats, trailers, waders and other fishing equipment can spread harmful aquatic invasive species from waterbody to waterbody unless properly cleaned after use. DEC regulations prohibit boats from launching or leaving sites without first draining the boat and cleaning the boat, trailer and equipment. Furthermore, many New York counties, towns, and villages also have laws in place that prohibit the transport of aquatic invasive species on boats, trailers and equipment.To avoid spreading invasive species, follow the 'Clean.Drain.Dry.' method for properly disinfecting your boat and equipment before launching. If you need help, many public boat launches have boat stewards on-site to inspect your watercraft and gear.Use our interactive map feature to locate a boat inspection station and boat steward near you.Certificate Requirements for Boating in the Adirondack Park: As of June 2022, all boaters operating any kind of motorized watercraft in the Adirondack Park and within ten miles of the Blue Line are required by law to possess certification that their vessel has undergone the proper cleaning measures to prevent the spread of aquatic invasive species. Boaters can get their certification from a boat steward at a DEC designated inspection station or by completing a self-issued certificate (PDF) prior to launch. Have questions about this new regulation? See our Frequently Asked Questions (PDF)Register your Boat at the DMVIf you use a motor (electric or fuel-driven), no matter how small the craft or the motor, you must register your boat with the Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV).You can either register your boat online or call the DMV at (518) 486-9786. (Note: In New York, watercraft without a motor do not need to be registered.)Boating Safety Courses and CertificationFor information about boating certificate requirements and boating safety courses, call the OPRHP at (518) 474-0456 or visit the OPRHP boating education page.
contexts.title: Motor Boating - NYSDEC

ml.tokens.model_text: register my boat and boat trailer

messages.original_text:
To register your boat and boat trailer in New York, you will need to follow these steps:
1. Register your boat with the Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV). You can do this online or by calling the DMV at (518) 486-9786. Note that if your boat is powered by a motor (electric or fuel-driven), it must be registered, regardless of the size of the craft or the motor. However, watercraft without a motor do not need to be registered.
2. Register your boat trailer with the DMV as well. The process for registering a boat trailer is similar to that of registering a boat.
3. Make sure to properly clean your boat, trailer, and equipment before launching to prevent the spread of aquatic invasive species.
For more information, you can refer to the NYSDEC's Motor Boating webpage or contact the DMV directly.

messages.speaker: user
messages.text: Can I use my NY safety certificate in other states?

messages.speaker: agent
messages.text: Yes, the New York Safe Boating Certificate is nationally accredited and valid in other states and Canada. However, the Adventure License is not acceptable proof of a safe boating certificate outside of New York State.

contexts.text:
Boating Frequently Asked Questions - NYS Parks, Recreation & Historic Preservation

We do not have all course records prior to 2000. Any certificate issued prior to 2000 is only acceptable if you have a copy of it and you were under 18 years of age when it was issued. All NYS boating safety certificates issued
	after 2000, regardless of age, are acceptable.
I took course prior to 2000, but lost my certificate - what should I do?
	Unfortunately, we do not have records for all students who took the course prior to the year 2000. Search for your record online at ilostmycard.com. You can also email us at boating@parks.ny.gov with your name and date of birth to search for your record. If your record is not found, you will need to retake the course to obtain a certificate.
Can I use my NY safety certificate in other states?
	Yes, because the New York Safe Boating Certificate is nationally accredited and valid in other states and Canada. Please note that the Adventure License is not acceptable proof of a safe boating certificate outside of New York State.
I'm visiting New York. Will my safety certificate from my home state be sufficient?
	Yes, provided it was issued from your current state of residence, and the course was approved by the National Association of Boating Law Administrators. Look for the NASBLA logo on your certificate.
I just bought a motor boat; will I need a course immediately?
	In 2024, if you were born January 1, 1978 or later, you will need a certificate before you can legally operate the boat. Starting in 2025, everyone, regardless of age, will need a certificate before they can legally operate their boat.
Will I need a course in order to rent a motorboat in New York?
	No. If you are at least 18 years old, you may rent without completing a course. The livery must demonstrate how to properly use the boat before renting it. Persons under the age of 18 may only rent a motorboat if they hold a 
	safety certificate.
I lost my safety certificate. How can I get a replacement?
	You can order your replacement certificate online at https://www.ilostmycard.com/
What if I lost my temporary certificate?
contexts.title: Boating Frequently Asked Questions - NYS Parks, Recreation & Historic Preservation

messages.speaker: user
messages.text: how much is the class and what type of payment do you accept?

messages.speaker: agent
messages.text: The cost of the boating safety course may vary, but students 18 years of age and older will be required to pay a $10 fee to NYS for issuance of a permanent boating safety certificate. Payment for certificates (both first time and replacement) must be made online at <https://www.ilostmycard.com/>. Please note that no cash or personal checks are accepted. If you require an alternative payment method, you must email [Boating@parks.ny.gov](mailto:Boating@parks.ny.gov).

contexts.text:
Boating Frequently Asked Questions - NYS Parks, Recreation & Historic Preservation

A boating safety certificate issued by the US Coast Guard Auxiliary is recognized as a valid safe boating certificate – you do not need any further documentation. The same is true of certificates issued by the US Power Squadron/America’s Boating Club.
I took a class online and I have lost my permanent card, can you issue me a replacement card?
	You need to go to the online provider that issued your card. The same is true for lost Power Squadron and Coast Guard Auxiliary cards. NYS can only issue replacement certificates for the NY Safe Boating Course.
The back of my certificate says its approved by "NASBLA". What is that? 
	The National Association of State Boating Law Administrators (NASBLA) is a national nonprofit organization that works to develop public policy for recreational boating safety. NASBLA represents the recreational boating 
	authorities of all 50 states and the U.S. territories.

In Classroom Course
This course is designed as a comprehensive boating safety course, teaching the fundamentals of safe boating operation and has been approved by the National Association of Boating Law Administrators (NASBLA).

Students must be at least 10 years of age to attend the course.
This course requires a minimum of 8 hours of classroom instruction.
Courses are available throughout the state.
You must register for your course online at https://www.register-ed.com/programs/new_york/252-new-york-safe-boating-course
An instructor may or may not charge a fee for the course. If a fee is charged, they may vary depending upon who is offering the course. Some courses may be taught by volunteers free of charge.
Students will receive a temporary boating safety certificate upon completion of the course.
Permanent boating safety certificates do not expire.

Fees
Courses are taught by volunteer or paid instructors. Volunteers are free of charge, but an instructor may charge a fee for the course. Fees may vary.
Students 18 years of age and older will be required to pay a $10 fee to NYS for issuance of a permanent boating safety certificate.
Cost for a replacement certificate is $10.00 regardless of age

contexts.text:
Boating Frequently Asked Questions - NYS Parks, Recreation & Historic Preservation

Fees
Courses are taught by volunteer or paid instructors. Volunteers are free of charge, but an instructor may charge a fee for the course. Fees may vary.
Students 18 years of age and older will be required to pay a $10 fee to NYS for issuance of a permanent boating safety certificate.
Cost for a replacement certificate is $10.00 regardless of age
How do I find out if there is a fee for the class?
	Course fees will be listed in the “About this Event” section of the class listing. Find a course near you at https://www.register-ed.com/programs/new_york/252-new-york-safe-boating-course
What type of payment do you accept?
	Payment for certificates (both first time and replacement) must be made online at https://www.ilostmycard.com/. No cash or personal checks are accepted.

	If you require an alternative payment method, you must email us at Boating@parks.ny.gov

Can I pay my instructor for my permanent card?
	No, you must send your application for a permanent boating safety certificate and $10 fee to this office.

New York Safe Boating online programs
I have found a variety of on-line boating courses. Does NYS recognize all these courses?
	Although there are several on-line providers of "boating education", only those listed on the Parks webpage are acceptable in meeting the State's boater education requirements.
Can I apply for the Adventure License program?
	Students successfully completing the on-line course are also eligible to apply for the Adventure License. You must log back into the online course you took and complete the transaction there. Alternatively, you can bring your certificate directly to a DMV office to process.
	
	I took an online class and I've lost my boating safety certificate. Can NYS Parks issue me a replacement certificate?
	Duplicate certificates and any problems with the on-line courses will be handled by the online provider. On-line support and a phone number can be found at the course provider's website.
contexts.title: Boating Frequently Asked Questions - NYS Parks, Recreation & Historic Preservation

messages.original_text:
The cost of the boating safety course may vary depending on the instructor, but students 18 years of age and older will be required to pay a $10 fee to NYS for issuance of a permanent boating safety certificate. Payment for certificates (both first time and replacement) must be made online at <https://www.ilostmycard.com/>. No cash or personal checks are accepted. If you require an alternative payment method, you must email [Boating@parks.ny.gov](mailto:Boating@parks.ny.gov).
To find out the fee for a specific class, check the "About this Event" section of the class listing on the registration website: <https://www.register-ed.com/programs/new_york/252-new-york-safe-boating-course>.

|assistant|: In New York, certain individuals are required to have a boating safety certificate. Specifically, anyone operating a Personal Watercraft (JetSki™, Wave Runner™, etc.) must have a boating safety certificate and be at least 14 years of age or older. Starting in 2024, if you are operating any other type of motorized boat, you will need a safety certificate if you were born on or after January 1, 1978. Starting in 2025, all operators of motorized vessels, regardless of age, will be required to have a safety certificate. However, if you are renting a boat, you do not need a safety certificate if you are at least 18 years old, although the livery must demonstrate how to properly use the boat before renting it. Persons under the age of 18 may only rent a motorboat if they hold a safety certificate.
|user|: I need to register my boat and boat trailer
|assistant|: You can either register your boat online or call the DMV at (518) 486-9786. Note that if your boat is powered by a motor (electric or fuel-driven), it must be registered, regardless of the size of the craft or the motor.
|user|: Can I use my NY safety certificate in other states?
|assistant|: Yes, the New York Safe Boating Certificate is nationally accredited and valid in other states and Canada. However, the Adventure License is not acceptable proof of a safe boating certificate outside of New York State.
|user|: how much is the class and what type of payment do you accept?
|assistant|: The cost of the boating safety course may vary, but students 18 years of age and older will be required to pay a $10 fee to NYS for issuance of a permanent boating safety certificate. Payment for certificates (both first time and replacement) must be made online at <https://www.ilostmycard.com/>. No cash or personal checks are accepted. If you require an alternative payment method, you must email [Boating@parks.ny.gov](mailto:Boating@parks.ny.gov). 
|user|: do I still need to get a New York State Boating Safety Certificate if I have certificate from other parties?

contexts.text:
Boating Frequently Asked Questions - NYS Parks, Recreation & Historic Preservation

You must log back into the online course you took and complete the transaction there. Alternatively, you can bring your certificate directly to a DMV office to process.
	
	I took an online class and I've lost my boating safety certificate. Can NYS Parks issue me a replacement certificate?
	Duplicate certificates and any problems with the on-line courses will be handled by the online provider. On-line support and a phone number can be found at the course provider's website.
I have a certificate from a Coast Guard Auxiliary boating safety course, do I still need to get a New York State Boating Safety Certificate?
	No, the certificate from the Coast Guard Auxiliary course is a boating safety certificate recognized as acceptable by New York State.
I have a certificate from a Power Squadron boating safety course, do I still need to get a New York State Boating Safety Certificate?
	No, the certificate from the Power Squadron course is a boating safety certificate recognized as acceptable by New York State.
I have a certificate from a US Powerboating safety course, do I still need to get a New York State Boating Safety Certificate?
	No, the certificate from the US Powerboating course is a boating safety certificate recognized as acceptable by New York State.

New York State Adventure License Program
Who is eligible for the Adventure License boating icon?
	Anyone successfully completing the New York Safe Boating Course may opt to have their driver's license, non-driver ID, or learner's permit indicate completion of the course.
I have a NYC ID; can I have the boating icon put on that ID?
	No, the icon can only be placed on licenses and ID's issued by the NYS DMV.
Do I need to notify DMV before they renew my license or ID?
	No. DMV will maintain a record of your having completed the boating safety course, and automatically place the icon on your license each time it is renewed.
I have a U.S. Coast Guard License; Can that be listed on the Adventure License?
	No, only boating safety certificates can be listed.
What happens if I move out of state?
contexts.title: Boating Frequently Asked Questions - NYS Parks, Recreation & Historic Preservation

ml.tokens.model_text: No, the certificate from the Coast Guard Auxiliary course is a boating safety certificate recognized as acceptable by New York State.

messages.original_text: If you have a boating safety certificate from the US Coast Guard Auxiliary, the US Power Squadron/America’s Boating Club, or US Powerboating, you do not need to obtain a New York State Boating Safety Certificate, as these certificates are recognized as valid in New York State. However, if you took a class online and lost your permanent card, you need to contact the online provider that issued your card for a replacement. NYS can only issue replacement certificates for the NY Safe Boating Course.

messages.speaker: user
messages.text: tell me some information about New York State Adventure License Program, please?

messages.speaker: agent
messages.text: You can turn your NYS driver license into an “adventure license” by adding your lifetime sporting and recreation privileges.  Students successfully completing the on-line course are also eligible to apply for the Adventure License. The New York State Adventure License Program allows eligible individuals to have their driver's license, non-driver ID, or learner's permit indicate completion of the New York Safe Boating Course. This icon is only available for licenses and IDs issued by the NYS DMV, and DMV will automatically place the icon on the license each time it is renewed. However, a U.S. Coast Guard License cannot be listed on the Adventure License. If you move out of state, you must apply for a NY Non-Driver ID to maintain the Adventure License status.

contexts.text:
Boating Frequently Asked Questions - NYS Parks, Recreation & Historic Preservation

Fees
Courses are taught by volunteer or paid instructors. Volunteers are free of charge, but an instructor may charge a fee for the course. Fees may vary.
Students 18 years of age and older will be required to pay a $10 fee to NYS for issuance of a permanent boating safety certificate.
Cost for a replacement certificate is $10.00 regardless of age
How do I find out if there is a fee for the class?
	Course fees will be listed in the “About this Event” section of the class listing. Find a course near you at https://www.register-ed.com/programs/new_york/252-new-york-safe-boating-course
What type of payment do you accept?
	Payment for certificates (both first time and replacement) must be made online at https://www.ilostmycard.com/. No cash or personal checks are accepted.

	If you require an alternative payment method, you must email us at Boating@parks.ny.gov

Can I pay my instructor for my permanent card?
	No, you must send your application for a permanent boating safety certificate and $10 fee to this office.

New York Safe Boating online programs
I have found a variety of on-line boating courses. Does NYS recognize all these courses?
	Although there are several on-line providers of "boating education", only those listed on the Parks webpage are acceptable in meeting the State's boater education requirements.
Can I apply for the Adventure License program?
	Students successfully completing the on-line course are also eligible to apply for the Adventure License. You must log back into the online course you took and complete the transaction there. Alternatively, you can bring your certificate directly to a DMV office to process.
	
	I took an online class and I've lost my boating safety certificate. Can NYS Parks issue me a replacement certificate?
	Duplicate certificates and any problems with the on-line courses will be handled by the online provider. On-line support and a phone number can be found at the course provider's website.
contexts.title: Boating Frequently Asked Questions - NYS Parks, Recreation & Historic Preservation

If you are within 7 days of your temporary certificate’s expiration date and have not yet received your card, you are advised to email [boating@parks.ny.gov](mailto:boating@parks.ny.gov). ml.tokens.model_text: Who is eligible for the Adventure License boating icon?

contexts.text:
Boating Frequently Asked Questions - NYS Parks, Recreation & Historic Preservation

No, the icon can only be placed on licenses and ID's issued by the NYS DMV.
Do I need to notify DMV before they renew my license or ID?
	No. DMV will maintain a record of your having completed the boating safety course, and automatically place the icon on your license each time it is renewed.
I have a U.S. Coast Guard License; Can that be listed on the Adventure License?
	No, only boating safety certificates can be listed.
What happens if I move out of state?
	If you move out of state you must relinquish your NY Driver license and apply for a driver's license in your new state. In order to maintain the Adventure License status you will need to apply for a NY Non-Driver ID which will include that designation and maintain it continuously.
I have a lifetime fishing and hunting license and a boating safety certificate. Can I put all three on my driver's license?
	Yes you may.
I live in NY but I have an out of state boating safety certificate, do I qualify for the Adventure License program?
	No, you must have a New York safe boating certificate to be eligible.
I got my boating safety certificate online and tried to get the Adventure License through my provider but I when I click on the link it brings me back to a NYS information page. What do I have to do?
	You must log into your account created with your online provider. For more information, click on the link below for your provider and follow the directions on the document that pops up. Alternatively, you can bring your printed certificate to any DMV office.

Boat US       Boat-Ed       
	Boater Exam       US Power Squadron       
	Aceboater

I paid my fee and I have not received my new license/permit/ID yet. Who do I call?
	You can check on the mailing status with DMV.
Customers who wish to add the anchor icon to their enhanced driver's license must have an up-to-date photo on file with DMV in order for their request to be processed successfully. If your photo is out of date, please

messages.original_text: The New York State Adventure License Program allows eligible individuals to have their driver's license, non-driver ID, or learner's permit indicate completion of the New York Safe Boating Course. This program is only available for licenses and IDs issued by the NYS DMV, and DMV will automatically place the icon on the license each time it is renewed. The Adventure License can also include designations for lifetime fishing and hunting licenses. However, a U.S. Coast Guard License cannot be listed on the Adventure License. If you move out of state, you must apply for a NY Non-Driver ID to maintain the Adventure License status.

messages.speaker: user
messages.text: are there any safety I need to know?

messages.speaker: agent
messages.text: Boaters can prevent most accidents by learning safe boating techniques and using common sense. California boating safety courses are designed to provide boaters with state specific boating laws and federal navigation requirements in many different environments to suit individual boater needs.  It is also designed to increase boating safety on California waterways. Carrying the proper safety equipment on your boat is not only smart, it’s the law! You can find the required safety equipment for your type of boat.

contexts.text:
Boating Safety and Education for All
About 85% of all boating deaths occur on boats where the operator has not completed a boating safety education course. The California Boater Card education program is designed to increase boating safety on California waterways. Check out these pages for boating safety and education information.

Boating Accident Statistics
Boating Safety Fact Sheets
How to File a Float Plan
Life Jacket Loaner Program

Life Jackets
Propeller Safety
Paddlecraft
Boating Accident Report Form
California Boating Course

Boater Education Requirements 
The good news: Boaters can prevent most accidents by learning safe boating techniques and using common sense. California boating safety courses are designed to provide boaters with state specific boating laws and federal navigation requirements in many different environments to suit individual boater needs. There are home study, classroom, online and on-the-water courses.The California Boater Card requirements can be found in the links below. If you are looking for a basic course to fulfill the card requirements, be sure to check that it is on the list of approved courses. If you are looking for more advanced courses, check out the many providers and aquatic centers throughout the state. Parents and teachers can give their children and students a head start on boating and water safety through the K-12 AquaSmart safety curriculum.

California Boater Card (CBC)
Courses/Classes
2023 California Boater Card Program Report
2022 California Boater Card Program Report
2021 California Boater Card Program Report
2020 California Boater Card Program Report
2019 California Boater Card Program Report
2018 California Boater Card Program Report

K-12 Education
Boating and Waterways is mandated (Section 51879.7 of the California Education Code)  to provide fundamental water safety training for all the children of the state, so California’s youth will be able to enjoy water recreation while avoiding its hazards. DBW developed the award-winning AquaSMART curriculum program available to K-12 teachers and parents. The division is also active in many youth outreach events and through traditional and online media to fulfill its responsibility of boating safety education for California children and youth.

Aquatic Centers
Life Jackets
AquaSmart/School Assemblies
Children's Outdoor Bill of Rights

Outreach
Preventing boating and water accidents begins with outreach education.
contexts.title: Boating Safety and Education for All

Boating Safety and Education for All

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Alert: Effective January 1, 2024 - Are you 60 years of age or younger? All motorized vessel operators 60 and younger are required by law to complete a boating safety course and obtain a California Boater Card before heading out on the water. For more information about the California Boater Card, list of approved courses and exemptions, please visit CaliforniaBoaterCard.com.
Welcome to the California Division of Boating and Waterways (DBW) safety and education page!  DBW relies on partnerships with many organizations (educational institutions, aquatic centers, the U.S. Coast Guard Auxiliary and America's Boating Club/U.S. Power Squadrons) and more to provide boating safety education and positive outreach to children, youth, and adults. If you are a first-time boater or if you just want to learn the latest "rules of the road", this page will help make your boating activities safe and enjoyable.

Boating Safety
Play it Safe! Almost 800,000 pleasure craft are registered in California, and the rapidly rising numbers of unregistered paddlecraft bring the number of active boaters to over four million. That’s a lot of Californians having a lot of boating adventures on thousands of miles of beautiful waterways! Unfortunately, some boaters will get hurt or die while on the water. The Coast Guard reports nearly 5,000 boating accidents each year in the United States—causing approximately 700 deaths, 3,000 injuries and $36 million in damage. About 85% of all boating deaths occur on boats where the operator has not completed a boating safety education course. The California Boater Card education program is designed to increase boating safety on California waterways. Check out these pages for boating safety and education information.

Boating Accident Statistics
Boating Safety Fact Sheets
How to File a Float Plan
Life Jacket Loaner Program

Life Jackets
Propeller Safety
Paddlecraft
Boating Accident Report Form

Lake Tahoe

American River

Dana Point

Folsom Lake SRA

Mono Lake Tufa SRA

Our Mission
To provide safe and convenient public access to California's waterways and leadership in promoting safe, enjoyable and environmentally sound recreational boating.

State Parks
Commissions

Historic Preservation
Off-Highway Vehicles

California Boater Card Apply Now!

 Do you operate a motorized vessel on California waterways? Take note: beginning January 1, 2018, boaters 20 years of age and younger are the first age group that must carry a California Boater Card when on state waterways.
 

Safety Equipment
Carrying the proper safety equipment on your boat is not only smart, it’s the law! Click here to find the required safety equipment for your type of boat. The ABCs of California Boating includes California boating law in an easy to read format.

Mussel Fee (Quagga) Sticker

 California DMV-registered vessels operating in fresh waterways must display a current “Mussel Fee Sticker” on the vessel’s hull next to the registration sticker. Paying the mussel fee is a separate DMV transaction from the registration sticker. Please go to www.dmv.ca.gov/MusselFee to purchase your sticker. They are also available at DMV field offices and at AAA, for members.
 

Places to Boat in CA

 No matter where you boat in California, a water adventure awaits you—each one as big and unique as the state itself. It can be majestic as sailing around San Francisco Bay within view of the Golden Gate Bridge, or as heart-thumping as riding the flows of the Lower Kern River. Pick a destination!
 

Pump Out Stations

 Pump it. Don’t Dump it! It’s against the law. Raw sewage can spread disease, contaminate shellfish beds, and lower oxygen levels in water.
contexts.title: Division of Boating and Waterways

messages.original_text: Yes, there are several safety precautions you should take when boating. First, always wear a life jacket and ensure that there are enough life jackets on board for all passengers. Second, familiarize yourself with the boat and its equipment before setting out. Third, check the weather forecast and water conditions before you go boating. Fourth, follow all navigation rules and be aware of other boats, swimmers, and obstacles in the water. Fifth, never operate a boat while under the influence of alcohol or drugs. Sixth, take a boating safety course to learn about safe boating practices and laws. Finally, always file a float plan with someone on shore, so they know your boating plans and can alert authorities if you don't return on time.
